<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations (all dollar amounts in thousands, except per share and revenue per equivalent admissions amounts)
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Annual Report and the documents that are incorporated by reference in this Annual Report contain certain
	forward-looking statements within the meaning of the safe harbor for forward-looking statements contained in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Forward-looking statements include all statements that do not relate solely to
	historical or current facts and may be identified by the use of words such as &#147;may,&#148; &#147;believe,&#148; &#147;will,&#148; &#147;seeks to&#148;, &#147;expect,&#148; &#147;project,&#148; &#147;estimate,&#148; &#147;anticipate,&#148;
	&#147;plan&#148; or &#147;continue.&#148; These forward-looking statements are based on the current plans and expectations and are subject to a number of risks, uncertainties and other factors which could significantly affect current plans and
	expectations and our future financial condition and results. For a listing and a discussion of such factors, which could cause actual results, performance and achievements to differ materially from those anticipated, see Certain Cautionary
	Statements&#151;Forward Looking Information and Item&nbsp;1A.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Critical Accounting Estimates
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The preparation of financial statements in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles requires us to make estimates and
	assumptions that affect reported amounts and related disclosures. We consider an accounting estimate to be critical if:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	it requires assumptions to be made that were uncertain at the time the estimate was made; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	changes in the estimate or different estimates that could have been made could have a material impact on our consolidated statement of earnings or financial condition.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The table of critical accounting estimates that follows is not intended to be a comprehensive list of all of our accounting policies that
	require estimates. We believe that of our significant accounting policies, as discussed in Note 2 of our Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, the
	estimates discussed below involve a higher degree of judgment and complexity. We believe the current assumptions and other considerations used to estimate amounts reflected in our consolidated financial statements are appropriate. However, if actual
	experience differs from the assumptions and other considerations used in estimating amounts reflected in our consolidated financial statements, the resulting changes could have a material adverse effect on our consolidated results of operations and
	financial condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	47
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The table that follows presents information about our critical accounting estimates, as well as
	the effects of hypothetical changes in the material assumptions used to develop each estimate:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_11"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="39%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Balance Sheet or Income Statement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Caption/Nature of Critical Estimate Item
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:162.25PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Assumption / Approach Used
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Sensitivity Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Receivables-net&nbsp;and&nbsp;Provision&nbsp;for&nbsp;Bad&nbsp;
	Debts
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Receivables-net for our Healthcare Facilities Segment primarily consists of amounts due from third-party payors and patients from providing
	healthcare services to healthcare facility patients. Receivables-net for our Specialty Pharmacy Segment primarily consists of amounts due from third-party payors; institutions such as nursing homes, home health, hospice, hospitals; pharmacy stores;
	Medicaid Part D program; and customers from the sale of pharmacy services and merchandise. Our ability to collect outstanding receivables is critical to our results of operations and cash flows. To provide for accounts receivable that could become
	uncollectible in the future, we establish an allowance for doubtful accounts to reduce the carrying value of such receivables to their estimated net realizable value. The primary uncertainty lies with accounts for which patients are responsible,
	which we refer to as patient responsibility accounts. These accounts include both amounts payable by uninsured patients and co-payments and deductibles payable by insured patients. Our allowance for doubtful accounts, included in our balance sheets
	as of June&nbsp;30 was as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2016&#151;$991; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015&#151;$2,770.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our provision for bad debts, included in our results of continuing operations for the years ended June&nbsp;30, was as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2016&#151;$2,068
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015&#151;$4,041; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2014&#151;$4,050
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The largest component of bad debts in our patient accounts receivable for our healthcare facilities and Specialty Pharmacy Segments relates
	to accounts for which patients are responsible, which we refer to as patient responsibility accounts. These accounts include both amounts payable by uninsured patients and co-payments and deductibles payable by insured patients. In general, we
	attempt to collect deductibles, co-payments and self-pay accounts prior to the time of service for non-emergency care. If we do not collect these patient responsibility accounts prior to the delivery of care, the accounts are handled through our
	billing and collections processes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We attempt to verify each patient&#146;s insurance
	coverage as early as possible before a scheduled non-emergency admission or procedure, including with respect to eligibility, benefits and authorization/pre-certification requirements, in order to notify patients of the estimated amounts for which
	they will be responsible. We attempt to verify insurance coverage within a reasonable amount of time for all emergency room visits and non-emergency urgent admissions in compliance with the Emergency Medical Treatment and Active Labor Act.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A significant increase in our provision for doubtful accounts (as a percentage of revenues) would lower our earnings. This would adversely
	affect our results of operations, financial condition, liquidity and potentially our future access to capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If net revenues during fiscal year 2016 were changed by 1%, our 2016 after-tax income from continuing operations would change by approximately $634 or diluted
	earnings per share of $0.07.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This is only one example of reasonably possible
	sensitivity scenarios. The process of determining the allowance requires us to estimate uncollectible patient accounts that are highly uncertain and requires a high degree of judgment. It is impacted by, among other things, changes in regional
	economic conditions, business office operations, payor mix and trends in private and federal or state governmental healthcare coverage.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	48
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_12"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="39%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Balance Sheet or Income Statement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Caption/Nature of Critical Estimate Item
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:162.25PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Assumption / Approach Used
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Sensitivity Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	In general, we utilize the following steps in collecting accounts receivable: if possible, cash collection of all or a portion of deductibles, co-payments and self-pay accounts prior to or at the time service is
	provided;&nbsp;billing and follow-up with third party payors;&nbsp;collection calls;&nbsp;utilization of collection agencies; sue to collect if the patient has the means to pay and chooses not to pay; and&nbsp;if collection efforts are unsuccessful,
	write off the accounts.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Our policy is to write off accounts after all collection efforts have failed, which is typically no longer than 120 days after the date of discharge of the patient or service to the patient or customer. Patient responsibility
	accounts represent the majority of our write-offs. All of our subsidiaries&#146; hospitals retain third-party collection agencies for billing and collection of delinquent accounts. At most of our subsidiaries&#146; hospitals, more than one
	collection agency is used to promote competition and improved performance. The selection of collection agencies and the timing of the referral of an account to a collection agency vary among hospitals. Generally, we do not write off accounts prior
	to utilizing the services of a collection agency. Once collection efforts have proven unsuccessful, an account is written off from our patient accounting system against the allowance for doubtful accounts.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	49
</P>

	Balance Sheet or Income Statement

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Caption/Nature of Critical Estimate Item
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:162.25PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Assumption / Approach Used
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Sensitivity Analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We determine the adequacy of the allowance for doubtful accounts utilizing a number of analytical tools and benchmarks. No single
	statistic or measurement alone determines the adequacy of the allowance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We monitor
	our revenue trends by payor classification on a quarter-by-quarter basis along with the composition of our accounts receivable agings. This review is focused primarily on trends in self-pay revenues, accounts receivable, co-payment receivables and
	historic payment patterns.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, we analyze other factors such as day&#146;s
	revenue in accounts receivable and we review admissions and charges by physicians, primarily focusing on recently recruited physicians.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The above table shows, as of June&nbsp;30, 2016, net Healthcare Facilities Segment accounts receivable aged from patient date of service and are grouped by classification of verified insurance coverage. The receivables
	are net of contractual allowances and allowance for doubtful accounts. Contractual allowances and the allowance for doubtful accounts are calculated by payor class and are not calculated by the aging of the patient billing date; therefore, these
	allowances have been allocated within the aging of the various payor classes based upon gross patient receivable amounts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Revenue recognition / Net Patient
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Service Revenues
</I>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="5">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For our Healthcare Facilities Segment, we recognize revenues in the period in which services are provided. For our Specialty
	Pharmacy Segment, we recognize revenues in the period in which services are provided and at the time the customer takes possession of merchandise. Patient receivables primarily consist of amounts due from third-party payors and patients. Amounts we
	receive for treatment of patients covered by governmental programs, such as Medicare and Medicaid, and other third-party payors, such as HMOs, PPOs and other private insurers, are determined pursuant to contracts or established government rates and
	are generally less than our established billing rates. Accordingly, our gross revenues and patient receivables are reduced to net amounts receivable pursuant to such contracts or government payment rates through an allowance for contractual
	discounts. Approximately 96.6%, 92.8% and 91.5% of our revenues during the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, relate to discounted charges. The sources of these revenues were as follows for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016
	(as a percentage of total revenues):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Medicare&#151;37.1%;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Medicaid&#151;37.7%; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Commercial insurance and other
	sources&#151;25.2%.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Revenues&nbsp;are&nbsp;recorded&nbsp;at&nbsp;estimated
<BR>
	amounts due from patients, third-
<BR>
	party payors, institutions,
<BR>
	pharmacies, and others for
<BR>
	healthcare and pharmacy services
<BR>
	and goods provided net of
<BR>
	contractual
	discounts pursuant to
<BR>
	contract or government payment
<BR>
	rates. Estimates for contractual
<BR>
	allowances are calculated using
<BR>
	computerized and manual
<BR>
	processes depending on the type of
<BR>
	payor involved. In certain hospitals,
<BR>
	the
	contractual allowances are
<BR>
	calculated by a computerized
<BR>
	system based on payment terms for
<BR>
	each payor. In other hospitals, the
<BR>
	contractual allowances are
<BR>
	estimated manually using historical
<BR>
	collections for each type of payor.
<BR>
	For
	all hospitals, certain manual
<BR>
	estimates are used in calculating
<BR>
	contractual allowances based on
<BR>
	historical collections from payors
<BR>
	that are not significant or have not
<BR>
	entered into a contract with us. All
<BR>
	contractual adjustments
	regardless
<BR>
	of type of payor or method of
<BR>
	calculation are reviewed and
<BR>
	compared to actual experience on a
<BR>
	periodic basis.
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Accounts receivable primarily
<BR>
	consist&nbsp;of&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;due&nbsp;from&nbsp;third
<BR>
	party payors, institutions,
<BR>
	pharmacies, and
	patients.
<BR>
	Amounts we receive for the
<BR>
	treatment of patients covered by
<BR>
	HMOs, PPOs and other private
<BR>
	insurers are generally less than
<BR>
	our established billing rates. We
<BR>
	include contractual allowances as
<BR>
	a reduction to revenues in
	our
<BR>
	financial statements based on
<BR>
	payor specific identification and
<BR>
	payor specific factors for rate
<BR>
	increases and denials.
</P>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_17"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="5" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Balance Sheet or Income Statement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:140.65PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Caption/Nature of Critical Estimate Item
<BR>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except
	per
<BR>
	share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<B>
	Assumption / Approach Used
</B>
<BR>
<B>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except
</B>
<BR>
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Sensitivity
	Analysis
<BR>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD COLSPAN="5" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Governmental payors
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Governmental&nbsp;payors
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="5">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD COLSPAN="5" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The majority of services
<BR>
	performed on Medicare and
<BR>
	Medicaid patients are reimbursed
<BR>
	at predetermined reimbursement
<BR>
	rates.&nbsp;The&nbsp;differences&nbsp;between&nbsp;the
<BR>
	established billing rates (i.e.,
<BR>
	gross
	charges) and the
<BR>
	predetermined reimbursement
<BR>
	rates are recorded as contractual
<BR>
	discounts and deducted from
<BR>
	gross charges. Under this
<BR>
	prospective reimbursement
<BR>
	system, there is no adjustment or
<BR>
	settlement of the
	difference
<BR>
	between the actual cost to provide
<BR>
	the service and the predetermined
<BR>
	reimbursement rates.
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Discounts for retrospectively
<BR>
	cost-based revenues, which were
<BR>
	more prevalent in periods before
<BR>
	2000, are estimated based on
<BR>
	historical and current
	factors and
<BR>
	are adjusted in future periods
<BR>
	when settlements of filed cost
<BR>
	reports are received.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Final settlements under all
<BR>
	programs are subject to
<BR>
	adjustment based on
<BR>
	administrative review and audit
<BR>
	by third party intermediaries,
<BR>
	which can
	take several years to
<BR>
	resolve completely.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Because the laws and regulations governing&nbsp;the&nbsp;Medicare&nbsp;and&nbsp;Medicaid
	programs&nbsp;are&nbsp;complex&nbsp;and&nbsp;subject&nbsp;to change, the estimates&nbsp;of contractual discounts we record could change by material amounts. Adjustments related to final settlements for revenues retrospectively increased (decreased)
	our revenues from continuing operations by the following amounts for the years ended June 30:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2016&#151;$(786);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015&#151;$(540) and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2014&#151;$624.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="5">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD COLSPAN="5" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	Commercial Insurance
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	Commercial&nbsp;Insurance
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="5">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD COLSPAN="5" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	For most managed care plans,
<BR>
	contractual allowances estimated
<BR>
	at the time of service are adjusted
<BR>
	to actual contractual allowances
<BR>
	as cash is received and claims are
<BR>
	reconciled. We evaluate the
<BR>
	following criteria
	in developing
<BR>
	the estimated contractual
<BR>
	allowance percentages: historical
<BR>
	contractual allowance trends
<BR>
	based on actual claims paid by
<BR>
	managed care payors; review of
<BR>
	contractual allowance
<BR>
	information reflecting
	current
<BR>
	contract terms; consideration and
<BR>
	analysis of changes in payor mix
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If our overall estimated contractual discount percentage on all of our commercial revenues during 2016 were changed by 1%, our 2016 after-tax
	income from continuing operations would change by approximately $69. This is only one example of reasonably possible sensitivity scenarios. The process of determining the allowance requires us to estimate the amount expected to be received and
	requires a high degree of judgment. It is impacted by changes in managed care contracts and other related factors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:140.65PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Analysis

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	reimbursement levels; and other
<BR>

<BR>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	A&nbsp;significant&nbsp;increase&nbsp;in&nbsp;our&nbsp;estimate of contractual discounts would lower our earnings. This would adversely affect our results of operations, financial condition, liquidity and future access to
	capital.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="8">
<B>
<I>
	Goodwill, other intangible assets and accounting for business combinations
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="9">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="8">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Goodwill represents the excess of the purchase price over the fair value of the net assets (including separately identified
	intangible assets) of acquired companies. The Company has one reportable business segment with goodwill. Goodwill included in our consolidated balance sheets as of June&nbsp;30 for the following years was as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ROWSPAN="13">
	In accordance with FASB
<BR>
	Accounting Standards
<BR>
	Codification 350-10,
<BR>
	&#147;Intangibles&#151;Goodwill and
<BR>
	Other,&#148; (&#147;ASC 350-10&#148;) goodwill
<BR>
	and intangible assets with
<BR>
	indefinite lives are
	reviewed by
<BR>
	us at least annually for
<BR>
	impairment. For purposes of these
<BR>
	analyses, the estimate of fair
<BR>
	value is based on the income
<BR>
	approach, which estimates the fair
<BR>
	value based on future discounted
<BR>
	cash flows. The estimate of
	future
<BR>
	discounted cash flows is based on
<BR>
	assumptions and projections that
<BR>
	are believed to be currently
<BR>
	reasonable and supportable. If it
<BR>
	is determined the carrying value
<BR>
	of goodwill or other intangible
<BR>
	assets to be impaired,
	then the
<BR>
	carrying value is reduced.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ROWSPAN="13" VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
</TR>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="8">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The goodwill resulted from the 2008 acquisition of our specialty pharmacy business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s other intangible assets relate to Certificates of Need
	(&#147;CON&#148;), non-competition agreements, trade name, customer relationships and Medicare licenses. CON, Non-competition agreements, customer relationships, and Medicare licenses are amortized over the terms of the agreements. The trade name
	has been determined to have an indefinite life and, accordingly, is not amortized.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The&nbsp;purchase&nbsp;price&nbsp;of&nbsp;acquisitions
<BR>
	is allocated to the assets acquired
<BR>
	and liabilities assumed based
<BR>
	upon their respective fair values
<BR>
	and are subject to change during
<BR>
	the twelve month
	period
<BR>
	subsequent to the acquisition
<BR>
	date. We engage
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	independent&nbsp;third-party&nbsp;valuation
</FONT>
<BR>
	firms to assist us in determining
<BR>
	the fair values of assets acquired
<BR>
	and liabilities assumed
	at the time
<BR>
	of acquisition. Such valuations
<BR>
	require us to make significant
<BR>
	estimates and assumptions,
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>

	3,858

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="9">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="8">
<B>
<I>
	Professional and general liability claims
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="9">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="4">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="8">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are subject to potential medical malpractice lawsuits and other claims as part of providing healthcare services. To mitigate a
	portion of this risk, we have maintained insurance for individual malpractice claims exceeding a self-insured retention amount. Our self-insurance retention amount was $1,000 on individual malpractice claims for each contract year commencing
	March&nbsp;1, 2011.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each year, we obtain quotes from various malpractice insurers
	with respect to the cost of obtaining medical malpractice insurance coverage. We compare these quotes to our most recent actuarially determined estimates of losses at various self-insured retention levels. Accordingly, changes in insurance costs
	affect the self-insurance retention level we choose each year. As insurance costs increase, we may accept a higher level of risk in self-insured retention levels.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The reserve for professional and
<BR>
	general liability claims is based
<BR>
	upon independent actuarial
<BR>
	calculations, which consider
<BR>
	historical claims data,
<BR>
	demographic considerations,
<BR>
	severity factors and other
<BR>
	actuarial
	assumptions in the
<BR>
	determination of reserve
<BR>
	estimates.
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The reserve for professional
	and
<BR>
	general liability claims reflects
<BR>
	the current estimate of all
<BR>
	outstanding losses, including
<BR>
	incurred but not reported losses,
<BR>
	based upon actuarial calculations
<BR>
	as of the balance sheet date. The
<BR>
	loss estimates included in
	the
<BR>
	actuarial&nbsp;calculations&nbsp;may&nbsp;change
<BR>
	in the future based upon updated
<BR>
	facts and circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We&nbsp;revise&nbsp;our&nbsp;reserve&nbsp;estimation
<BR>
	process by obtaining independent
<BR>
	actuarial calculations quarterly.
</P>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
<BR>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Actuarial&nbsp;calculations&nbsp;include&nbsp;a large number of variables that may significantly impact the estimate of ultimate losses
	recorded during a reporting period. In determining loss estimates, professional judgment is used by each actuary by selecting factors that are considered appropriate by the actuary for our specific circumstances. Changes in assumptions used by our
	independent actuary with respect to demographics and geography, Industry trends, development patterns and judgmental selection of other factors may impact our recorded reserve levels and our results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Changes in our initial estimates of professional and general liability claims are
	non-cash charges and accordingly, there would be no material impact currently on our liquidity or capital resources.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	55

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="5" NOWRAP>

<B>
	Balance Sheet or Income Statement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:140.65PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	per
<BR>

	Assumption / Approach Used
</B>
<BR>
<B>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except
</B>
<BR>
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Sensitivity
	Analysis
<BR>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The reserve for professional and general liability claims included in our&nbsp;consolidated balance sheets as of June&nbsp;30 was
	as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2016&#151;$1,391; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015&#151;$979
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The total increases (decreases) for professional and general liability coverage, included in our consolidated results of operations for the years ended
	June&nbsp;30, was as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2016&#151;$678;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015&#151;$78; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2014&#151;$(272).
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Our estimated reserve for
<BR>
	professional&nbsp;and&nbsp;general liability
<BR>
	claims will be significantly
<BR>
	affected if current and future
<BR>
	claims differ from historical
<BR>
	trends. While we monitor
<BR>
	reported claims closely
	and
<BR>
	consider potential outcomes as
<BR>
	estimated by our independent
<BR>
	actuaries when determining our
<BR>
	professional and general liability
<BR>
	reserves, the complexity of the
<BR>
	claims, the extended period of
<BR>
	time to settle the claims and
	the
<BR>
	wide range of potential outcomes
<BR>
	complicates the estimation
<BR>
	process. In addition, certain
<BR>
	states, including Georgia, have
<BR>
	passed varying forms of tort
<BR>
	reform which attempt to limit the
<BR>
	number and types of claims and
<BR>
	the
	amount of some medical
<BR>
	malpractice awards. If enacted
<BR>
	limitations remain in place or if
<BR>
	similar laws are passed in the
<BR>
	states where our other hospitals
<BR>
	are located, our loss estimates
<BR>
	could decrease. Conversely,
<BR>
	liberalization
	of the number and
<BR>
	type of claims and damage
<BR>
	awards permitted under any such
<BR>
	law applicable to our operations
<BR>
	could cause our loss estimates to
<BR>
	increase.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="5">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">
<B>
<I>
	Accounting for income taxes
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">
	Deferred tax assets generally represent items that will result in a tax deduction in future years for which we have already recorded the tax benefit in our income statement. We assess the likelihood that deferred tax
	assets will be recovered from future taxable income. To the extent we believe that recovery is not probable, a valuation allowance is established. To the extent we establish a valuation allowance or increase this allowance, we must include an
	expense as part of the income tax provision in our results of
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The first step in determining the
<BR>
	deferred tax asset valuation
<BR>
	allowance is identifying reporting
<BR>
	jurisdictions where we have a
<BR>
	history&nbsp;of&nbsp;tax&nbsp;and&nbsp;operating&nbsp;losses
<BR>
	or are projected to have
	losses in
<BR>
	future periods as a result of
<BR>
	changes in operational
<BR>
	performance. We then determine
<BR>
	if&nbsp;a&nbsp;valuation&nbsp;allowance&nbsp;should&nbsp;be
<BR>
	established against the deferred
<BR>
	tax assets for that reporting
<BR>
	jurisdiction.
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:2.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our deferred tax assets were $12,974 and our deferred tax liabilities were $0 at June 30, 2016, excluding the impact of
	valuation allowances. At June 30, 2016, the Company evaluated the need for a valuation against our deferred tax assets and determined that it was&nbsp;more likely than not that $2,322&nbsp;of&nbsp;our deferred tax assets&nbsp;would be&nbsp;realized.
	As a&nbsp;result,&nbsp;in accordance&nbsp;with ASC
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	56
</P>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_22"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="25%">
</TD>

</TD>

</TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="8%">

<TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="8%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="5" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Balance Sheet or Income Statement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000; WIDTH:140.65PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Caption/Nature of Critical Estimate Item
<BR>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except
	per
<BR>
	share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<B>
	Assumption / Approach Used
</B>
<BR>
<B>
	(dollar amounts in thousands, except
</B>
<BR>
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Sensitivity
	Analysis
<BR>
	(dollar&nbsp;amounts&nbsp;in&nbsp;thousands,&nbsp;except
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	per share)
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	operations. Our net deferred tax asset balance (net of valuation allowance) in our consolidated balance sheets as of June&nbsp;30
	for the following years was as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2016&#151;$2,322; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015&#151;$6,852.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our valuation allowances for deferred tax assets in our consolidated balance sheets as of June&nbsp;30 for the following years were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2016&#151;$10,652; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2015&#151;$2,564.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, significant judgment is required in determining and assessing the impact of certain tax-related contingencies. We establish accruals when, despite
	our belief that our tax return positions are fully supportable, it is probable that we have incurred a loss related to tax contingencies and the loss or range of loss can be reasonably estimated.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We adjust the accruals related to tax contingencies as part of our provision for income
	taxes in our results of operations based upon changing facts and circumstances, such as the progress of a tax audit, development of industry related examination issues, as well as legislative, regulatory or judicial developments. A number of years
	may elapse before a particular matter, for which we have established an accrual, is audited and resolved.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The second step is to determine
<BR>
	the amount of the valuation
<BR>
	allowance. We will generally
<BR>
	establish a valuation allowance
<BR>
	equal to the net deferred tax asset
<BR>
	(deferred tax assets less deferred
<BR>
	tax liabilities)
	related to the
<BR>
	jurisdiction identified in the first
<BR>
	step of the analysis. In certain
<BR>
	cases, we may not reduce the
<BR>
	valuation allowance by the
<BR>
	amount of the deferred tax
<BR>
	liabilities depending on the nature
<BR>
	and timing of future
	taxable
<BR>
	income attributable to deferred
<BR>
	tax liabilities.
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In&nbsp;assessing&nbsp;tax&nbsp;contingencies, we
<BR>
	identify tax issues that we believe
<BR>
	may be challenged upon
<BR>
	examination by the taxing
<BR>
	authorities.
	We also assess the
<BR>
	likelihood of sustaining tax
<BR>
	benefits associated with tax
<BR>
	planning strategies and reduce tax
<BR>
	benefits based on management&#146;s
<BR>
	judgment regarding such
<BR>
	likelihood. We compute the tax
<BR>
	on each contingency. We
	then
<BR>
	determine the amount of loss, or
<BR>
	reduction in tax benefits based
<BR>
	upon the foregoing and reflects
<BR>
	such amount as a component of
<BR>
	the provision for income taxes in
<BR>
	the reporting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During each reporting period,
	we
<BR>
	assess&nbsp;the&nbsp;facts&nbsp;and&nbsp;circumstances
<BR>
	related to recorded tax
<BR>
	contingencies. If tax
<BR>
	contingencies are no longer
<BR>
	deemed probable based upon new
<BR>
	facts and circumstances, the
<BR>
	contingency is reflected as
	a
<BR>
	reduction of the provision for
<BR>
	income taxes in the current
<BR>
	period.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	740, we recognized a total valuation allowance of $10,652 against the deferred tax asset so that the net tax asset was $2,322 at June 30,
	2016. We conducted our evaluation by considering available positive and negative evidence to determine our ability to realize our deferred tax assets. In our evaluation, we gave more significant weight to evidence that was objective in nature as
	compared to subjective evidence. Also, more significant weight was given to evidence that directly related to our current financial performance as compared to less current evidence and future plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The&nbsp;IRS&nbsp;may&nbsp;propose&nbsp;adjustments&nbsp;for
	items&nbsp;we&nbsp;have&nbsp;failed&nbsp;to&nbsp;identify&nbsp;as&nbsp;tax contingencies. If the IRS were to propose and sustain assessments equal to 10% of our taxable income for 2016, we would incur approximately $0 of additional tax expense for
	2016 plus applicable penalties and interest.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Financial Summary
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The results of continuing operations shown in the historical summary below are for our two business segments, Healthcare Facilities and
	Specialty Pharmacy. The results of the Company&#146;s Chestatee Regional Hospital (&#147;Chestatee&#148;) which sold on August 19, 2016, have been reclassified as discontinued operations in our consolidated financial statements for the fiscal years
	ended June 30, 2016, 2015 and 2014. As a result, their results are not included in Healthcare Facilities Segment results discussed.
</P>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Electronic health records incentives
</P>

<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; BORDER-TOP:3.00PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; BORDER-TOP:3.00PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Equivalent admissions
</I>
	&#151;Equivalent admissions is used by management (and certain investors) as a
	general approximation of combined inpatient and outpatient volume. Equivalent admissions are computed by multiplying admissions (inpatient volume) by the sum of gross inpatient revenues and gross outpatient revenues and dividing the result by gross
	inpatient revenues. The equivalent admissions computation is intended to relate outpatient revenues to the volume measure (admissions) used to measure inpatient volume to result in a general approximation of combined inpatient and outpatient volume
	(equivalent admissions).
</P>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Results of Operations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our net revenues are from our two business segments, Healthcare Facilities and Specialty Pharmacy.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	58
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage59"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Healthcare Facilities net revenues decreased $9,471 or 23.7% in the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016
	compared to the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. Net revenue from all payer sources decreased compared to last year. Medicare and Managed Care net revenues decreased 30.5% and 32.5%, respectively, from the prior year. Medicaid net revenues decreased
	9.0% from the prior year while Self-pay net revenues decreased 64.9%. The lower revenues were generally due to lower in-patient volumes and the emergency department at one hospital closing. The lower patient volumes for the periods above result from
	several factors. One facility does not accept the insurance provided by Health Insurance Marketplace plan offered through the Federal government due to the low reimbursement rates offered by the plan in calendar 2015. This facility also made
	renovations at the facility (now completed) which disrupted the patient areas resulting in lower volume. This facility also closed its emergency department in September 2014 in order to reduce its bad debt experience from self-pay admissions. The
	change resulted in a loss of physicians, which have not yet been replaced, and in decreased admissions. Another hospital facility had reduced admissions due to changes in physician staffing as well as the negative perception and publicity resulting
	from a proposal to lease the emergency room and medical office building to a regional healthcare system and discontinue inpatient services. An agreement was reached in early June 2016 and the facility will lease a portion of the hospital building
	and a medical office building to an unaffiliated healthcare provider. Inpatient services at the hospital were discontinued in June 2016. The medical office building lease began in July 2016 and the emergency room lease is expected to begin by
	November 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Healthcare Facilities net revenues decreased $54 in the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 compared to the year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2014. Medicare and Self-pay net revenues decreased 3.8% and 15.9%, respectively, from the prior year. Medicaid new revenues increased 4.9% from the prior year while Managed Care net revenues increased 4.7%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Specialty Pharmacy Segment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net revenues
	for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 decreased 2.9% from the prior year, with decreased institutional pharmacy revenues and infusion therapy revenues somewhat offset by increased durable medical equipment (DME) revenues and retail pharmacy
	revenues. Institutional pharmacy revenues decreased 11.0% and infusion therapy pharmacy revenues decreased by 25.1% while retail pharmacy revenues increased 3.3% and DME increased 10.4% in 2016 as compared to 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net revenues for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 decreased 0.4% from the prior year, with decreased infusion therapy revenues somewhat
	offset by increased institutional and retail pharmacy and DME revenues. Revenue from the sale of one infusion drug which is primarily sold to Medicaid covered customers decreased by approximately $3,695 due to Louisiana Medicaid restricting both the
	number of eligible customers and number of approved doses of the drug. Institutional pharmacy revenues increased 29.3%, retail pharmacy revenues increased 3.4% and DME increased 8.2% in 2015 as compared to 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net revenues for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014 remained consistent with the prior year net revenues; however, fiscal 2014 included a net
	increase in pharmacy net revenues of $957 due primarily to additional institutional pharmacy contracts and a net decline in durable medical equipment sales of $949 due primarily to the elimination of certain unprofitable items. Although fiscal 2014
	retail and institutional pharmacy script volumes increased 8.7% as compared to fiscal 2013, the corresponding pharmacy net revenues decreased 4.1%, primarily as a result of decreases in reimbursement rates, including Medicare, Medicaid and managed
	care; the negative effects of significant brand-to-generic conversion activity; and, a significant increase in exclusive preferred provider network arrangements between major pharmacy benefit managers and certain retail chain pharmacies. Fiscal 2014
	infusion therapy net revenues increased 2.0% as compared to fiscal 2013, primarily related to certain higher reimbursed specialty pharmacy services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	59
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Healthcare Facilities Segment Cost and Expenses
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Costs and expenses for our Healthcare Facilities, including depreciation and amortization, were $33,534, $35,369, and $35,980, for the fiscal
	years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

	Salaries, wages and benefits

</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Salaries, wages and benefits expense, purchased services expense and other operating expenses increased as a
	percentage of net revenue in the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 primarily due to the 23.7% decrease in net revenues from the prior year. Salaries, wages and benefits expense as a percentage of total net revenues were relatively unchanged in the year
	ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 compared to the prior year. Other operating expenses increased $274 in fiscal 2016 due to professional liability expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Purchased services decreased as a percentage of net revenues for the fiscal year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 compared to the prior fiscal year
	due reduced legal fees, medical professional fees and outside collection expense.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	EHR incentive payments as a percentage of net revenue
	are 0.0%, (0.1%)&nbsp;and (5.7%)&nbsp;for the fiscal years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. No Medicare incentive payments were received in the fiscal years 2016 and 2015. We believe we will receive minimal EHR incentive
	payments in future periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Depreciation and amortization expense was $618, $664, and $737 for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015,
	and 2014, respectively. The decreases in depreciation and amortization expense resulted from assets being fully over depreciated the past several years.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
